content: frisbees for dogs paws for thought when you re ticked off and things get ruff get a new leash on life and have fun with a dog these frisbees are sturdy and durable fun for a dog to catch they also have a handle-lip deep enough to play tug it is a very easy spiral pattern and can be made in about an hour you can personalize the frisbee with the dog s name or add appliques like bones or paw prints so go fetch your hook and yarn and ruff one out in no time materials 2 balls ww 100% cotton yarn total about 125 yds for one frisbee 6 5mm / k hook large yarn needle abbreviations chain = chain decrease = decrease by crocheting 2 single crochets as one increase = increase with 2 single crochets into one stitch round = round single_crochet = single_crochet slip_stitch = slip_stitch fo = fasten_off us terminology gauge not critical 3 sts / 3 row = 1 size about 8 in diameter frisbee round 1 hold 2 strands decrease chain 11 join to the first chain to form a ring 18 single_crochet in the ring note do not join work in spiral mark beginning stitch of each round 18 round 2 single_crochet 2 increase around 24 round 3 single_crochet increase single_crochet 2 around 30 round 4 single_crochet 3 increase single_crochet around 36 round 5 increase single_crochet 5 around 42 round 6 single_crochet 3 increase single_crochet 3 around 48 round 7 single_crochet increase single_crochet 6 around 54 round 8 single_crochet 8 increase around 60 round 9 single_crochet 5 increase single_crochet 4 around 66 round 10 single_crochet 2 increase single_crochet 8 around 72 round 11 single_crochet even around 72 round 12 single_crochet 4 decrease around 60 round 13 single_crochet decrease single_crochet 2 around slip_stitch in next 3 sts fo and weave in 48 p perkins 2010
